sailpoint.integration

Class IIQClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.integration.IIQClient

  • public class IIQClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Class providing a convenient interface for SailPoint IIQ web services.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IIQClient.AuthorizationService
      Helper class IIQClient.checkAuthorization(String, String).
      static class  IIQClient.IdentityService
      Helper class for identity create and update methods.
      static class  IIQClient.PasswordService
      Helper class used by IIQClient.checkPasswordPolicy(String, String).

                      java.lang.String user,
                      java.lang.String password)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Configure the IIQClient reading the properties from CONFIG_FILE. If there is no properties file, just initialize using the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        baseURL - The base URL to use to override the properties file.
        user - The user to use to override the properties file.
        password - The password to use to override the properties file.

      • authenticate

        public java.lang.String authenticate()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Attempt to authenticate using the configured credentials.
        Returns:
        A JSON string of a Map that contains the name of the authenticated "identity" and an "outcome" with details about the authentication attempt (eg - "expiredPassword", "success", etc...).

        java.lang.Exception

      • checkRolePolicies

        public java.util.List checkRolePolicies(java.lang.String identity,
                                        java.util.List roles)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Given a list of potential role assignments, check to see if assigning these roles would violate any SOD policies.
        Parameters:
        identity - The name of the identity to check.
        roles - The names of the roles to check.
        Returns:
        A List of Strings that have the violated policy names and constraints separated by a colon; empty if there are no violations.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • checkPasswordPolicy

        public IIQClient.PasswordService.CheckPasswordResult checkPasswordPolicy(java.lang.String identity,
                                                                         java.lang.String password)
                                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Check the password for the given identity.
        Parameters:
        identity - The name of the identity to check.
        password - The password to check.
        Returns:
        A CheckPasswordResult containing the results.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • rolesAssignablePermits

        public java.lang.String rolesAssignablePermits(java.util.Map parameterMap,
                                               java.lang.String identity)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Return the roles that can be assigned to the given identity based on the role mode. If the role mode is "permitted", this returns all roles permitted by the assigned roles of the identity. If the role mode is "assignable" or not specified, this returns all assigned roles the identity does not currently have.
        Parameters:
        parameterMap - The Map to add the query parameters into; may contain pagination parameters.
        identity - The name of the identity.
        Returns:
        A String representation of a ListResult.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • showIdentity

        public java.lang.String showIdentity(java.lang.String identity)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Return a JSON string that has a map with the roles and viewable attributes for the requested identity.
        Parameters:
        identity - The Object ID of the identity to return.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getIdentityList

        public java.lang.String getIdentityList(java.lang.String identity)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the list of Identities for which the given Identity is authorized. Because the results can't be generated by a single search, paging and subset searching must be done by the caller.

        The number of search results is capped at 500 to preserve resources when searching deep hierarchies. One risk of this cap is the possibility of maxing out the search results on the hierarchy search before the scoped search is even engaged.

        The depth of subordinate recursion is capped at 5 for similar reasons. In a deep hierarchy, we want to at least capture the first few layers completely.

        NOTE: This now requires Identity ID. Name will no longer work

        Returns:
        List JSON formatted List of identities
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • updateIdentityRoleReferences

        public java.lang.String updateIdentityRoleReferences(java.lang.String identity,

                                                     java.lang.String requestComments)

      • aggregateAccount

        public RequestResult aggregateAccount(java.lang.String identity,
                                      java.lang.String appName,
                                      java.util.Map resourceObject,
                                      java.util.Map aggOptions)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Aggregate the given resource object for the requested app onto the given identity.
        Parameters:
        identity - The name of the identity to aggregate onto.
        appName - The name of the app for the resource object.
        resourceObject - A map of attribute names and values.
        aggOptions - Optional map of options for aggregation.
        Returns:
        The RequestResult.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • launchWorkflow

        public RequestResult launchWorkflow(java.lang.String workflowName,
                                    java.util.Map launchArgs)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Service that can launch a workflow remotely using IIQ.

        URI: workflows/$(nameOfDef)/launch

        The RequestResult's requestId will contain the id of the TaskResult that was created because of the workflow execution so it's status can be checked.

        This method is called by the IRM integration to perform provisioning activities like enable/ disable and role requests.

        Parameters:
        workflowName - The name or ID of the workflow to launch.
        launchArgs - The arguments for the workflow launch.
        Returns:
        RequestResult with the results of the launch.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTaskResultStatus

        public RequestResult getTaskResultStatus(java.lang.String taskId)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Return details about the task result given the name or id of the task result.

        URI: taskResults/$(resultIdOrName)/status

        This method is used by the IRM integration to detect the status of a TaskResult that was launched. ( because of a workflow execution )

        Parameters:
        taskId - The ID of the task to return.
        Returns:
        A RequestResults with the task result status.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • cancelWorkflow

        public RequestResult cancelWorkflow(java.lang.String taskId,
                                    java.lang.String comments)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Cancel a workflow.

        URI: taskResults/${resultId}/cancelWorkflow

        Parameters:
        taskId - The ID of the workflow to cancel.
        comments - The comments about the cancel request.
        Returns:
        A RequestResult with the results of canceling the workflow.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getLinks

        public ListResult getLinks(java.lang.String identityName,
                           boolean includeLinkState)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the links associated with the named identity. This method returns a ListResult which has a payload of objects in the getObjects() method.

        URI : identities/$(identityName)/linksWithState

        Parameters:
        identityName - The name of ID of the identity.
        Returns:
        ListResult containing the links.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • remoteLogin

        public java.lang.String remoteLogin(java.lang.String identityName)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a RemoteLoginToken on the IIQ Server side. This token can be passed back in IIQ requests to allow access into the IIQ application.

        This was initially developed for the BMC IRM integration where IRM wants to call into IIQ interface as the current authenticated SRM user in non-SSO environments.

        Parameters:
        identityName - The name of the identity for remote login.
        Returns:
        The remoteTokenId
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • passwordIntercept

        public java.lang.String passwordIntercept(java.lang.String application,
                                          java.lang.String identity,
                                          java.lang.String password)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Notify IIQ of a password intercept event.
        Parameters:
        application - The name of the application on which the password changed.
        identity - The name of the identity.
        password - The new password.
        Returns:
        A success string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
